SENT.plain: A woman had anosognosia for hemiplegia as a manifestation of brainstem infarction
She had no mental or neuropsychological disturbances, and had involvement of the brainstem in the frontal/parietal-subcortical circuits to the right cerebral hemisphere
Brainstem lesions that disrupt frontal/parietal-subcortical areas may affect anosognosia for hemiplegia
